ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Data file 1
ID for the Experiment/settings/run
Description of experiment/sequence/event
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Date of Data Entry
How much the participant favored control over reward
Did the data fit to a logistic function?
Mean reaction time for the mixed condition (seconds)
Mean reaction time for the baseline controllable condition (seconds)
Mean reaction time for the baseline uncontrollable condition (seconds)
Was the participant identified as an outlier?
Group
Site
When you played the card guessing game, how likely do you think you won and earned the points?
When the computer played the card guessing game for you, how likely do you think you won and earned the points?
How much did you like playing the game for yourself in order to try and earn the points?
How much did you like having the computer play the game for you in order to earn the points?
